prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism** The first part is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. 1. **Create a new coordinate system:** Use the following parameters for the coordinate system: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.2772, 0.0] 2. **Draw a 2D sketch (face_1) on the XY plane of the new coordinate system:** face_1 consists of a single loop (loop_1) with four lines (line_1, line_2, line_3, and line_4): - line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.2772, 0.0] - line\\_2: Start Point [0.2772, 0.0], End Point [0.2772, 0.2772] - line\\_3: Start Point [0.2772, 0.2772], End Point [0.0, 0.2772] - line\\_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.2772], End Point [0.0, 0.0] 3. **Draw a 2D sketch (face_2) on the XY plane of the new coordinate system:** face_2 consists of a single loop (loop_1) with an arc (arc_1) and a line (line_1): - arc\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.2772], Mid Point [0.1386, 0.1386], End Point [0.2772, 0.2772] - line\\_1: Start Point [0.2772, 0.2772], End Point [0.0, 0.2772] 4. **Scale the 2D sketch (face_1) by a factor of 0.2772 (sketch_scale):** Use the scaling factor to proportionally adjust the dimensions of all elements in the sketch. 5. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch (face_1) into a 3D sketch:** Apply the rotation and translation parameters from the coordinate system. 6. **Extrude the 2D sketch (face_1) to generate the 3D model:** Use the extrusion depth values to define the height of the prism. The `extrude_depth_towards_normal` value is 0.2772, while the `extrude_depth_opposite_normal` value is 0.0. The resulting 3D model should have the following dimensions as per the description: - Length: 0.2772 - Width: 0.2772 - Height: 0.2772 Note the slight variation in the dimensions due to the scaling and extrusion process.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,-90.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.2772,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.2772,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.2772,0.0],"End Point":[0.2772,0.2772]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.2772,0.2772],"End Point":[0.0,0.2772]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.2772],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}},"face_2":{"loop_1":{"arc_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.2772],"Mid Point":[0.1386,0.1386],"End Point":[0.2772,0.2772]},"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.2772,0.2772],"End Point":[0.0,0.2772]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.2772,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.2772,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Shape: Cylindrical Object with Central Hole Creating the Coordinate System 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles `[0.0, 0.0, -90.0]` and a translation vector of `[0.0, 0.75, 0.0]`. Creating the Sketch 2. On the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system, create a new sketch. 3. In the sketch, create face 1. 4. Within face 1, create loop 1 using a circle centered at `[0.2945, 0.2945]` with a radius of 0.2945. 5. Within face 1, create loop 2 using a circle centered at `[0.2945, 0.2945]` with a radius of 0.1178. Creating the Extrusion 6. Extrude face 1 by 0.1178 units in the normal direction. 7. Set the sketch scale parameter for this extrusion to 0.589. Part 2 Instructions Shape: Cylindrical Object with Flat Top and Bottom Creating the Coordinate System 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles `[0.0, 0.0, -90.0]` and a translation vector of `[0.0785, 0.6322, 0.0785]`. Creating the Sketch 2. On the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system, create a new sketch. 3. In the sketch, create face 1. 4. Within face 1, create loop 1 using a circle centered at `[0.216, 0.216]` with a radius of 0.216. 5. Within face 1, create loop 2 using a circle centered at `[0.216, 0.216]` with a radius of 0.1178. Creating the Extrusion 6. Extrude face 1 by 0.0393 units in the normal direction. 7. Set the sketch scale parameter for this extrusion to 0.4319. Combining the Parts 8. Join the part 1 cylindrical object with the part 2 cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, ensuring that the parts align properly. Height, width, and length values for each part: - Part 1: Height: 0.589, Width: 0.1178, Length: 0.589 - Part 2: Height: 0.4319, Width: 0.0393, Length: 0.4319</description>

<description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Curved Side Construct a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a curved side. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 1. Creating the 2D sketch: a. Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. b. Draw the first line from [0.0, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0]. c. Draw the second line from [0.75, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.75]. d. Draw the third line from [0.75, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.75]. e. Draw the fourth line from [0.0, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.0]. 2. Scaling the 2D sketch: Apply a scaling factor of 0.75 to the entire sketch. 3. Transforming the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch: Keep euler angles as [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and apply a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.1562]. 4. Extrude the 3D model: a. Extrude the sketch with a depth of 0.1562 towards the normal. b. Extrude the sketch with no depth in the opposite direction of the normal. Part 2: Flattened, Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism Construct a flattened, three-dimensional, rectangular prism. Start by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation vector: [0.0313, 0.0312, 0.2824] 1. Creating the 2D sketch: a. Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. b. Draw the first line from [0.0, 0.0] to [0.6875, 0.0]. c. Draw the second line from [0.6875, 0.0] to [0.6875, 0.6875]. d. Draw the third line from [0.6875, 0.6875] to [0.0, 0.6875]. e. Draw the fourth line from [0.0, 0.6875] to [0.0, 0.0]. 2. Scaling the 2D sketch: Apply a scaling factor of 0.6875 to the entire sketch. 3. Transforming the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch: Keep euler angles as [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and apply a translation vector of [0.0313, 0.0312, 0.125]. 4. Extrude the 3D model: a. Extrude the sketch with a depth of 0.125, interrupting the existing material. b. Extrude the sketch with no depth in the opposite direction of the normal. Final Shape The final three-dimensional shape is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. It has the following dimensions: * Length: 2 units * Width: 1 unit * Height: 0.5 units Keep these principals in mind during each part of the design process. By providing clear, concise instructions, our junior CAD engineer will be able to generate an accurate CAD model from this assembly JSON.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construction of a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin `[0, 0, 0]` with no rotation. 1. **Face 1:** Create a sketch on the XY plane. Draw a rectangle with the following vertices: * `[0, 0]` * `[0.4687, 0]` * `[0.4687, 0.75]` * `[0, 0.75]` 2. **Extrusion:** Extrude the sketch by 0.4687 units in the positive Z direction. Part 2: Construction of a 3D model of a rectangular prism with a smaller rectangular prism on top of it. Create a new coordinate system at the origin `[0, 0, 0.4687]` with no rotation. 1. **Face 1:** Create a sketch on the XY plane. Draw a rectangle with the following vertices: * `[0, 0]` * `[0.2812, 0]` * `[0.2812, 0.2812]` * `[0, 0.2812]` 2. **Face 2:** Create a sketch on the XY plane. Draw a rectangle with the following vertices: * `[0, 0.4687]` * `[0.2812, 0.4687]` * `[0.2812, 0.75]` * `[0, 0.75]` 3. **Extrusion:** Cut the sketch by 0.2812 units in the negative Z direction. Part 3: Construction of a three-dimensional, geometric shape with a triangular base and a pointed top. Create a new coordinate system at the origin `[0, 0, 0.2812]` with a rotation of -90 degrees around the Z axis. 1. **Face 1:** Create a sketch on the YZ plane. Draw a right triangle with the following vertices: * `[0, 0]` * `[0.2812, 0.2812]` * `[0, 0.2812]` 2. **Extrusion:** Cut the sketch by 0.375 units in the negative Y direction. Part 4: Construction of a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Create a new coordinate system at the origin `[0.2812, 0.1875, 0.1875]` with a rotation of 90 degrees around the X axis and -90 degrees around the Z axis. 1. **Face 1:** Create a sketch on the XZ plane. Draw a rectangle with the following vertices: * `[0, 0.2812]` * `[0.1875, 0]` * `[0.1875, 0.2812]` 2. **Extrusion:** Cut the sketch by 0.375 units in the negative Y direction.</description>
